text: Ballycastle is a small town in Northern Ireland, in the United Kingdom. ==Population facts== On 29 April 2001, the United Kingdom government had a census and saw that there were 5,089 people living in Ballycastle. They also saw that: *25.3% of people were under 16 years old and 18.7% were over 60 years old *46.8% of people were male and 53.2% were female *77.7% of people were from a Roman Catholic background and 20.5% were from a Protestant background. *5.5% of people aged 16â€“74 had no job.Northern Ireland Neighbourhood Information Service website. ==References== Category:Towns in Northern Ireland Category:Settlements in County Antrim
title: Ballycastle, County Antrim
